title: Yuma police: 2 kids hit in drive-by shooting
content:
Yuma police were searching Monday for an unknown assailant who fired shots into a vehicle, striking two children, officials said.
An 8-year-old boy and a 7-year-old girl suffered gunshot wounds Sunday, said a Yuma Police Department spokeswoman, Sgt. Lori Franklin.
Both were flown to a Phoenix hospital for treatment, and authorities had no immediate information on their medical conditions.
Franklin said the gunman fired multiple rounds at the vehicle around 9:30 p.m. near C.W. McGraw Elementary School. The assailant fled the scene in a newer-model, white Ford Expedition with smoked tail lights and a damaged driver's side rear door, Franklin said.
Police are asking anyone with information about the shooting to contact the Yuma Police Department at 928-373-4749 or 928-373-4700, or 928-782-7463 to remain anonymous.
